title: World News | Pak: Death Toll Rises to 18 in Tragic Paretabad LPG Blast | LatestLY
body:
Hyderabad [Pakistan], June 5 (ANI): The death toll from the tragic May 30 Paretabad LPG cylinder blast and fire incident climbed to 18 as four more individuals succumbed to their burns, Dawn reported.

Among the latest casualties are 17-year-old Alisha, the daughter of Zeeshan; 15-year-old Umair, son of Arshad; 14-year-old Abbas Ali, son of Mubarak; and 25-year-old Doda, son of Mehar Bagri.

Also Read | Latin America's Anger at China's Economic Clout Grows.

Zeeshan, who had already lost his son, Mohammad Hassan alias Ali Hyder, in the same calamity, now mourns the loss of his daughter. His five-year-old daughter, Kinza, remains hospitalised at the Civil Hospital Karachi with burns covering 29 per cent of her body, as reported by Dawn.

Meanwhile, Deputy Commissioner Zain Ul Abedin Memon has called upon the senior executive director (LPG) and the senior executive director (enforcement) of the Oil & Gas Regulatory Authority (Ogra) to take decisive action against illegal decanting points of LPG and CNG filling stations in Hyderabad.

Also Read | Lok Sabha Election Results 2024: French President Emmanuel Macron Congratulates 'Dear Friend' PM Narendra Modi on Historic Win, Hails Strategic Partnership With India.

In correspondence dated June 1, the DC has pledged full cooperation and coordination from the district administration and police to assist Ogra and its enforcement teams in achieving their objectives. He highlighted that many LPG shops and sale points were operating without the necessary permissions or NOCs.

Additionally, the DC has forwarded another letter through the Hyderabad commissioner to the home secretary, urging action against all such unlawful outlets, Dawn reported.

The cylinder blast and fire incident, which tragically claimed numerous lives, predominantly children, once again exposes the vulnerabilities and limitations of Liaquat University Hospital's burns ward.

The burns ward at LUH serves not only the healthcare needs of Hyderabad residents but also those from neighbouring districts in lower Sindh. However, it appears that the ward itself is struggling to survive.

Despite the completion of the construction of a multi-story building, the burns ward lacks a crucial component: a dedicated intensive care unit (ICU) for burns patients. Other essential components, despite being outlined in documents such as the project cost estimate (PC-I) initiated during Dr SM Tahir's tenure, are absent.

The unit has been operating under temporary arrangements for an extended period. Approximately two decades ago, it operated in a building deemed unsafe for habitation. Subsequently, it was relocated to a two-story structure consisting of outdated private wards.

Dr Tahir, who served with the burns unit from 2000 to 2018, expressed concerns about the adequacy of treatment in such an environment for burn victims when the unit was transferred to the old private wards building, Dawn reported. (ANI)

(This is an unedited and auto-generated story from Syndicated News feed, LatestLY Staff may not have modified or edited the content body)
summary:
The death toll from the May 30 LPG cylinder blast in Paretabad, Pakistan, has risen to 18, with four more victims succumbing to their injuries. The latest casualties include teenagers and a young adult, highlighting the tragedy's impact on families. Zeeshan, who lost his son in the incident, now mourns his daughter, while his five-year-old daughter remains hospitalized with severe burns.

Deputy Commissioner Zain Ul Abedin Memon has urged the Oil & Gas Regulatory Authority (Ogra) to take action against illegal LPG and CNG filling stations in Hyderabad. He has pledged full support from local authorities to enforce regulations and has called for action against unauthorized outlets.

The incident underscores the inadequacies of the Liaquat University Hospital's burns ward, which lacks a dedicated ICU and other essential facilities despite a new building. The ward has been operating under temporary conditions for years, raising concerns about the quality of care for burn victims. Dr. SM Tahir, a former burns unit head, has voiced concerns about the unit's capacity to provide adequate treatment.

title: Special Category Status for AP: Chandrababu Naidu's big demand and the BJP's compulsions
body:
In 1969, the Fifth Finance Commission of India introduced the mechanism of SCS to assist certain states in their development and fast-tracking growth if they faced historical economic or geographical disadvantages. Factors such as difficult and hilly terrain, low population density and/ or a sizable tribal population, strategic location along borders, economic and infrastructural backwardness, and non-viable nature of state finances were typically considered to accord SCS.

The system was scrapped on the recommendation of the 14th Finance Commission, which suggested that the resource gap of the states should be filled by increasing the devolution of tax to 42% from the existing 32%.

SCS was accorded to 11 states, including the entire Northeast, and the border hill states of Jammu and Kashmir, Himachal Pradesh, and Uttarakhand. Subsequently, other states too demanded SCS -- including Naidu's AP; Bihar, whose Chief Minister Nitish Kumar is another key NDA ally; and Odisha, where the BJP will now form the government.

Why does AP want Special Category Status?

When undivided AP was bifurcated to create Telangana in 2014 through the AP Reorganisation Act, 2014, the UPA government at the Centre had promised to grant SCS to AP to compensate for the loss of revenue, and of Hyderabad, where much of the development was concentrated.

After the Narendra Modi government took charge, both Naidu who was CM from 2014 to 2019, and Y S Jagan Mohan Reddy who was CM from 2019 to 2024, repeatedly appealed for SCS, so more funds were made available from the Centre to overcome the "distressing" financial situation of the state.

As per presentations made by the AP government to NITI Aayog, the body that succeeded the Planning Commission, the 14th Finance Commission estimated that the post-devolution revenue deficit for AP for the five-year period 2015-20 would be Rs 22,113 crore, but in reality, this figure stood at Rs 66,362 crore. The debt of the residuary state, which was Rs 97,000 crore at the time of bifurcation, reached Rs 2,58,928 crore by 2018-19, and is more than Rs 3.5 lakh crore now.

AP argues that the undivided state was bifurcated in an unjust and inequitable manner -- the successor state inherited nearly 59% of the population, debt, and liabilities of the original state, but only 47% of its revenues. For example, of the Rs 57,000 crore of software exports from AP for the year 2013-14, Hyderabad city -- with Telangana after the bifurcation -- alone accounted for Rs 56,500 crore.

Today's AP is essentially an agrarian state, with low economic buoyancy, leading to huge revenue disabilities. This is evident from the fact that the per capita revenue of Telangana for 2015-16 was Rs 14,411, while it was only Rs 8,397 for AP.

According to the AP government, the UPA had assured the nation, and especially the people of AP, that it would be granted SCS for a five-year period as a precondition to bifurcation, and that the residuary state would be adequately compensated through a number of development interventions, investments, and direct financial assistance.

And what would SCS mean for AP?

SCS would mean higher grants-in-aid to the state government from the Centre. To illustrate, per capita grants to Special Category States is Rs 5,573 crore per year, whereas AP receives only Rs 3,428 crore.

SCS states enjoy special industrial incentives such as Income-tax exemptions, custom duty waivers, reduced excise duty, corporate tax exemption for a certain period, concessions and exemptions relating to GST, and lower state and central taxes.

In SCS states, the Centre funds central schemes up to 90%, compared to 70% in non-SCS states.

Governments of AP have argued that such special incentives are vital for the rapid industrialisation of the primarily agrarian state, and would lead to improved employment opportunities for the youth and overall development of the state.

Granting SCS would encourage investments in specialty hospitals, five-star hotels, manufacturing industries, high-value service industries such as IT, and premier institutions of higher education and research, AP has argued.

What has the AP government done to press its demand with the Centre?

Naidu has been vocal and emotional about SCS, and it vexed him through his 2014-19 tenure as Chief Minister. The TDP was part of the first Modi government when it took power in 2014, and Naidu was frustrated by his failure to persuade the Centre of his case.

In March 2018, expressing anguish over the Centre's refusal to listen to his pleas, Naidu asked his two ministers at the Centre -- P Ashok Gajapati Raju (Civil Aviation) and Y Satyanarayana Chowdary (MoS, Science and Technology and Earth Sciences) -- to resign. He then quit the NDA and launched an anti-BJP, anti-Modi campaign for the Assembly election of May 2019.

When Naidu mentioned in the Legislative Assembly that he had gone to Delhi 29 times to meet NDA ministers to seek SCS, Y S Jagan Mohan Reddy and his YSRCP MLAs had laughed and poked fun at him. During the election campaign, Jagan attacked Naidu and TDP for their failure to get SCS for AP. However, after winning a landslide and becoming the Chief Minister in 2019, Jagan faced those same attacks and insults himself.

In February 2024, during the last Assembly session before the elections, Jagan expressed frustration and anguish over the issue, telling the Assembly that he wished that no party gets an absolute majority in Lok Sabha, so that the state can bargain for SCS. Naidu now has exactly that opportunity.

But how feasible is it for the Centre to yield to this demand?

The BJP has fallen short on numbers, and has very few options in its negotiations with Naidu, should he choose to play hardball. The Congress has already sent him feelers -- senior leader Jairam Ramesh has said that SCS for AP was part of the party's manifesto in the state, and the INDIA bloc would accept the demand if it comes to power at the Centre.

Giving Naidu what he wants to the exclusion of other states -- notably Bihar and Odisha -- will be difficult for the BJP. Also, the 14th Finance Commission had stated that SCS was a burden on the Centre's resources -- this has been used by the NDA to reject Naidu's pleas since 2014.

As a compromise, the NDA could make a promise similar to the one the UPA made: to give SCS for a specific period -- say, five years. The UPA had hoped that would assuage the anger of the people and create some breathing space; however, the BJP will be mindful that the Congress has not won a single MLA or MP seat in AP since 2014.

Naidu's earlier push for SCS had failed, and he had suffered a crushing defeat in the state as well. This time is different -- the BJP is dependent on him, and he has just won a landslide in the state. From his position of strength, he could settle for a compromise with favourable terms -- perhaps several Central projects in AP, a halt to the privatisation of the Vizag steel plant, increased assistance to backward districts, setting up of SEZs where the Centre would be able to waive taxes, etc.

All this could be in addition to ministerial portfolios of his choice in the new Modi government.
summary:
The article discusses the demand for Special Category Status (SCS) for Andhra Pradesh (AP) by its former Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu and the political complexities surrounding it. SCS was initially introduced in 1969 to aid states with economic or geographical disadvantages but was scrapped based on the 14th Finance Commission's recommendations. AP's demand for SCS stems from the financial challenges it faced post-bifurcation in 2014, which led to the creation of Telangana. The bifurcation resulted in significant revenue loss for AP, particularly from Hyderabad, a major economic hub.

Both Naidu and his successor, Y S Jagan Mohan Reddy, have repeatedly appealed for SCS to address AP's financial distress. The state argues that it inherited a disproportionate share of debt and liabilities compared to its revenues. SCS would provide AP with higher grants, industrial incentives, and greater central funding for schemes, which are crucial for its development and industrialization.

Naidu's efforts to secure SCS during his tenure from 2014 to 2019 included resigning from the NDA and launching an anti-BJP campaign. Despite his efforts, he failed to secure SCS, leading to political attacks from Jagan, who faced similar challenges after becoming CM in 2019.

With the BJP now lacking a majority, Naidu has a stronger negotiating position. The Congress has indicated support for SCS for AP, complicating the BJP's stance. The BJP might consider a compromise, such as granting SCS for a limited period or offering other concessions like central projects and tax incentives. Naidu's current political strength could enable him to secure favorable terms from the Centre.

title: India News | Uttar Pradesh: CM Yogi Adityanath Plants Sandalwood Sapling on World Environment Day | LatestLY
body:
Lucknow (Uttar Pradesh) [India], June 5 (ANI): Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath planted a sandalwood sapling at his official residence, on World Environment Day and his birthday, on Wednesday.

The Chief Minister also shared a message on X, saying, "Mata Bhoomi Putraham Prithviya (Mother Earth is my mother, and I am her son). I had the privilege of planting a tree in Lucknow today on World Environment Day. The Uttar Pradesh government is serving with full commitment for the protection and promotion of Mother Earth and nature."

Also Read | Devendra Fadnavis Proposes To Resign From Deputy CM Post: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde Says 'Poll Defeat is Collective Responsibility'.

The event was attended by Additional Chief Secretary (Chief Minister) S P Goyal, Additional Chief Secretary (Forest/Environment) Manoj Kumar Singh, Principal Secretary (Chief Minister) Sanjay Prasad, and DGP Prashant Kumar.

Earlier, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday launched the 'Ek Ped Maa Ke Naam' campaign on World Environment Day.

Also Read | Lok Sabha Election Results 2024: French President Emmanuel Macron Congratulates 'Dear Friend' PM Narendra Modi on Historic Win, Hails Strategic Partnership With India.

Under this campaign, he has urged people to plant a sapling in the upcoming days as a tribute to their mothers.

The Prime Minister planted a peepal tree sapling at Buddha Jayanti Park in the national capital today. He was accompanied by Union Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav and Delhi's Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena.

He also requested participants to share a picture of themselves planting the sapling using the hashtags #Plant4Mother.

"Today, on World Environment Day, delighted to start a campaign," he posted on X.

"I call upon everyone, in India and around the world, to plant a tree in the coming days as a tribute to your mother. Do share a picture of you doing so using #Plant4Mother," PM said in a post on X. PM also highlighted the need to protect the environment and shared his tree-planting experience, encouraging others to follow suit.

World Environment Day, observed on June 5, marks the start of the 1972 Stockholm Conference on the Human Environment. This year's theme is "Land Restoration, Desertification and Drought Resilience". (ANI)

(This is an unedited and auto-generated story from Syndicated News feed, LatestLY Staff may not have modified or edited the content body)
summary:
On World Environment Day, June 5, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath planted a sandalwood sapling at his official residence in Lucknow, coinciding with his birthday. He emphasized the state's commitment to environmental protection in a message shared on social media. The event was attended by key officials including Additional Chief Secretaries S P Goyal and Manoj Kumar Singh, Principal Secretary Sanjay Prasad, and DGP Prashant Kumar.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi also launched the 'Ek Ped Maa Ke Naam' campaign, encouraging people to plant saplings as a tribute to their mothers. He planted a peepal tree sapling at Buddha Jayanti Park in Delhi, accompanied by Union Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav and Delhi's Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena. Modi urged participants to share their tree-planting photos using the hashtag #Plant4Mother.

World Environment Day, observed annually on June 5, commemorates the 1972 Stockholm Conference on the Human Environment. This year's theme focuses on "Land Restoration, Desertification, and Drought Resilience."

title: World News | Heartfelt Congratulations to People of India for Vibrant Election Process: Sri Lanka's Foreign Minister, Jaishankar Extends Gratitude | LatestLY
body:
New Delhi [India], June 5 (ANI): External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar thanked his Sri Lankan counterpart Ali Sabry after he extended heartfelt congratulations to India on the successful completion of the "vibrant election process."

In a post on X, Ali Sabry said, "Heartfelt congratulations to the people of India on successfully completing a monumental and vibrant election process!."

"This extraordinary demonstration of democracy in action reflects the collective will and strength of your nation. Sri Lanka stands in admiration of your dedication to choosing your path forward. May this spirit of democracy continue to guide and inspire." he added.

Also Read | Lok Sabha Election Results 2024: French President Emmanuel Macron Congratulates 'Dear Friend' PM Narendra Modi on Historic Win, Hails Strategic Partnership With India.

https://x.com/DrSJaishankar/status/1798270179673333843

In response to his post on X, Jaishankar stated, "Thank you for your kind wishes, FM @alisabrypc."

Earlier in the day, Jaishankar also thanked his Jamaica's counterpart Kamina Johnson Smith for congratulating Prime Minister Narendra Modi on his third consecutive victory in the Lok Sabha elections.

In a post on X, Kamina Johnson Smith stated, "Joining in the warm congratulations of PM @AndrewHolnessJM to Prime Minister Modi on his 3rd term victory! We look forward to continuing to strengthen our bilateral cooperation and working together on issues important to the Global South @DrSJaishankar @hcikingston."

In response to her post on X, Jaishankar stated, "Appreciate your warm words and congratulations, FM @kaminajsmith."

Jamaican PM Andrew Holness also congratulated PM Modi.

In a post on X, Holness stated, "Congratulations to Prime Minister @narendramodi as he prepares to embark on a historic third term as India's head of government."

In response, PM Modi thanked Jamaican Prime Minister Andrew Holness and said he looks forward to working together for the welfare of the people of the two countries.

"Thank you Prime Minister @AndrewHolnessJM. India-Jamaica relations are marked by centuries-old people-to-people ties. I look forward to working together with you for the welfare of our people," PM Modi stated on X.

Wishes are pouring in from across the globe after Prime Minister Narendra Modi secured a third consecutive win in the Lok Sabha polls.

The leaders from neighbourhood nations like Maldives, and others, including Israel, Ukraine and Italy have also extended wishes to PM Modi.

The counting of the 2024 Lok Sabha elections was held on Tuesday. According to the Election Commission of India, the BJP won 240 seats, much lower than its 2019 tally of 303.

The Congress, on the other hand, registered a strong growth, winning 99 seats against 52 in 2019. (ANI)
summary: Sri Lanka's Foreign Minister Ali Sabry congratulated India on the successful completion of its election process, praising it as a demonstration of democracy. Indian External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar expressed gratitude for the congratulations. Additionally, Jamaican Foreign Minister Kamina Johnson Smith and Prime Minister Andrew Holness also congratulated Prime Minister Narendra Modi on his third consecutive victory in the Lok Sabha elections. Modi responded by emphasizing the strong ties between India and Jamaica. Global leaders, including those from Maldives, Israel, Ukraine, and Italy, have also extended their congratulations. The BJP won 240 seats in the 2024 Lok Sabha elections, while the Congress increased its tally to 99 seats.

title: India News | Odisha's 'giant Killer' -- BJP's Laxman Bag Who Defeated Five-time CM Naveen Patnaik | LatestLY
body:
Get latest articles and stories on India at LatestLY. BJP's Laxman Bag became a household name in Odisha overnight after he emerged as a "giant killer" by defeating Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik in the Kantabanji assembly seat in Bolangir district.

Bhubaneswar, Jun 5 (PTI) BJP's Laxman Bag became a household name in Odisha overnight after he emerged as a "giant killer" by defeating Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik in the Kantabanji assembly seat in Bolangir district.

Bag, 48, won the Kantabanji seat by 16,344 votes in a massive upset for the five-term CM who fought the elections from two seats. Patnaik won the Hinjili seat by 4,636 votes.

Also Read | Devendra Fadnavis Proposes To Resign From Deputy CM Post: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde Says 'Poll Defeat is Collective Responsibility'.

This was Patnaik's first electoral defeat after entering public life as the MP of Aska in 1998.

"I thank the people of Kantabanji for preferring me over Naveen Patnaik. I will try to meet the aspirations of the people," Bag said.

Also Read | Lok Sabha Election Results 2024: French President Emmanuel Macron Congratulates 'Dear Friend' PM Narendra Modi on Historic Win, Hails Strategic Partnership With India.

"Maybe he is the CM, but I had confidence in my people. I fought with full dedication to win and that has happened," he added.

Bag said that for him the biggest issue was the lack of employment in the area which was forcing people to migrate elsewhere.

In his election affidavit, he said he was a matric-pass and declared his profession as farmer. There were 12 criminal cases against him.

In the last election, Bag had lost to Santosh Singh Saluja of the Congress by a slender margin of 128 votes in Kantabaji.

(This is an unedited and auto-generated story from Syndicated News feed, LatestLY Staff may not have modified or edited the content body)
summary: Laxman Bag of the BJP gained significant attention in Odisha by defeating the five-time Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik in the Kantabanji assembly seat in Bolangir district. Bag won by a margin of 16,344 votes, marking Patnaik's first electoral defeat since he began his political career in 1998. Patnaik, however, secured a win in the Hinjili seat by 4,636 votes. Bag, a 48-year-old farmer with a matriculation education and 12 criminal cases against him, attributed his victory to the local people's preference and his focus on addressing employment issues. This victory is seen as a major upset and has significant political implications in the region.

title: World News | PM Modi Thanks Leaders of Israel, Malaysia, Singapore and Spain for Congratulating Him on Election Win | LatestLY
body:
Israel PM Benjamin Netanyahu, Spain PM Pedro Sanchez, PM Narendra Modi, Singapore PM Lawrence Wong, Malaysia PM Anwar Ibrahim

New Delhi [India], June 5 (ANI): Prime Minister Narendra Modi has thanked his counterparts from Israel, Malaysia, Singapore and Spain for congratulating him on his victory in the Lok Sabha elections.

Israel PM Benjamin Netanyahu extended wishes to PM Modi. While wishing PM Modi in a post on X, PM Modi stated, "Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, in a post on X, has extended wishes to Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday on being re-elected for a third consecutive term in the Lok Sabha polls."

Also Read | Latin America's Anger at China's Economic Clout Grows.

Responding to his congratulatory note, PM Modi said that he looked forward to further enhancing the friendship between Israel and India.

Taking to X, PM Modi stated, "Thank you Prime Minister @netanyahu for your warm wishes. Look forward to further enhancing India-Israel friendship and regional cooperation in the interest of peace, security and prosperity. Toda Raba!"

Also Read | Lok Sabha Election Results 2024: French President Emmanuel Macron Congratulates 'Dear Friend' PM Narendra Modi on Historic Win, Hails Strategic Partnership With India.

Malaysia's Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim congratulated PM Modi for winning the third consecutive term. Ibrahim stated that he looked forward to working with him as they forge a new era of ties between India and Malaysia. He also shared his old picture with PM Modi, where the two leaders were sharing a laugh while shaking hands.

"I congratulate Prime Minister Narendra Modi for winning a historic third consecutive term. The exercise of democracy in India is indeed a marvel. More than 642 million people have exercised their right to vote since April 19. Prime Minister Modi has overseen a historic reconfiguration of the Indian economy, one that promises a better life for India's citizenry as well as the region at large. I look forward to working closely with him as we forge a new era of relations between Malaysia and India," Anwar Ibrahim posted on X.

In response, PM Modi thanked Anwar Ibrahim for extending wishes. In a post on X, PM Modi stated, "Thank you Prime Minister @anwaribrahim for your kind words of congratulations. Look forward to working together for further advancing India-Malaysia Enhanced Strategic Partnership to the next high level."

Spanish PM Pedro Sanchez congratulated PM Modi on his win in the Lok Sabha polls. Calling India an "important partner" of Spain, he noted that the two nations will work together to address global challenges.

In a post on X, Sanchez stated, "My most sincere congratulations to @narendramodi for his electoral victory. India is an important partner of Spain and together we work to address global challenges. We will continue to strengthen our relationships in this new mandate."

After his congratulatory post on X, PM Modi expressed gratitude to Sanchez for his wishes. He noted that India deeply values its "special partnership" with Spain.

"Thank you Prime Minister @sanchezcastejon for your warm wishes. We deeply value our special partnership with Spain. Look forward to advancing our relationship with renewed vigour and energy," PM Modi posted on X.

Singapore PM Lawrence Wong congratulated PM Modi on NDA's victory in the Lok Sabha polls. Wong stated that he looked forward to working with PM Modi to deepen ties between India and Singapore.

Taking to X, Wong stated, "Congratulations @narendramodi on the historic victory by the NDA for the third consecutive term. Look forward to working with you to deepen the Singapore-India partnership and to celebrate the 60th anniversary of diplomatic ties next year."

In response to his congratulatory message, PM Modi stated that he looked forward to closely working with him to further strengthen the partnership between India and Singapore.

"Thank you Prime Minister @LawrenceWongST for your kind greetings. I too look forward to closely working with you to further strengthen our multi-faceted partnership," PM Modi stated on X.

Czech Republic PM Petr Fiala congratulated PM Modi on the victory of the BJP in the elections. He recalled his meeting with PM Modi in January.

In a post on X, Fiala stated, "My sincere congratulations to PM @narendramodi on the victory of the BJP in the general election. I have fond memories of our meeting in India in January, and I'm looking forward to our continued cooperation. India is a key partner for both the Czech Republic and the EU."

In response, PM Modi expressed gratitude to Fiala for his wishes and added that he looked forward to advancing ties between the two nations.

Taking to X, PM Modi stated, "Thank you my friend Prime Minister @P_Fiala. I warmly recall our meeting earlier this year during the Vibrant Gujarat Summit. Look forward to advancing our ties in the years to come."

Former Nepal PM Sher Bahadur Deuba congratulated PM Modi on securing a third consecutive term as India's Prime Minister and lauded PM Modi's leadership.

"Congratulations to @narendramodi ji, a great friend of Nepal, on securing a third consecutive term as Prime Minister of India following the BJP and NDA's victory. Your leadership, dedication, and vision continue to inspire and shape a bright future for India," Sher Bahadur Deuba posted on X.

In response, PM Modi said that he will continue to strengthen the ties between India and Nepal. Taking to X, PM Modi stated, "Thank you @SherBDeuba. We will continue strengthening the unique relationship between India and Nepal further."

The congratulatory messages of world leaders came as Prime Minister Narendra Modi has secured a third term. However, the BJP will need to rely on the support of other parties in his coalition - JD (U) chief Nitish Kumar and TDP's chief Chandrababu Naidu.

The counting of the 2024 Lok Sabha elections was held on Tuesday. The Election Commission of India has declared the results of the 543 Lok Sabha constituencies, with the BJP winning 240 seats and the Congress 99.

The BJP fell 32 seats short of the 272 majority mark after votes polled in the 2024 Lok Sabha elections were counted. For the first time, since the Bharatiya Janata Party swept to power in 2014, it did not secure a majority on its own. (ANI)
summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has expressed gratitude to several world leaders for congratulating him on his victory in the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. Leaders who extended their congratulations include Israel's PM Benjamin Netanyahu, Malaysia's PM Anwar Ibrahim, Spain's PM Pedro Sanchez, Singapore's PM Lawrence Wong, Czech Republic's PM Petr Fiala, and former Nepal PM Sher Bahadur Deuba. Each leader highlighted the importance of their respective countries' relationships with India and expressed a desire to strengthen bilateral ties. Despite the BJP winning 240 seats, it fell short of the 272 majority mark, necessitating coalition support from parties like JD(U) and TDP. This marks the first time since 2014 that the BJP did not secure a majority on its own.

title: India News | TMC Calls Meeting of Newly Elected MPs at Mamata's Residence on Saturday | LatestLY
body:
Kolkata (West Bengal) [India], June 5 (ANI): The Trinamool Congress has called a meeting of all newly elected MPs of the party at 4 pm on Saturday at Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's residence in Kolkata's Kalighat.

The Bharatiya Janata Party's (BJP) campaign strategy for Lok Saabha Polls in West Bengal failed to bring fruitful results as Trinamool Congress won 29 seats in the state.

Also Read | Devendra Fadnavis Proposes To Resign From Deputy CM Post: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde Says 'Poll Defeat is Collective Responsibility'.

West Bengal contributes 42 Lok Sabha seats in the 543-member Parliament. The BJPs' main focus was to dislodge Mamata Banerjee from West Bengal and even targeted the TMC government over Sandeshkhali, but the BJP won in 12 seats, down from its earlier tally of 18 seats in the 2019 polls.

Earlier on Tuesday as the Lok Sabha results were announced, West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee demanded resignation from Prime Minister Narendra Modi and said that he has lost his credibility since he had said that he would cross 400 seats but could not.

Also Read | Lok Sabha Election Results 2024: French President Emmanuel Macron Congratulates 'Dear Friend' PM Narendra Modi on Historic Win, Hails Strategic Partnership With India.

TMC chairperson Banerjee said, "The Prime Minister has lost credibility, he should resign immediately because he had said that this time they would cross 400 seats. I had said that there is a doubt that the BJP would cross even 200 seats. Now they have to hold the feet of Janata Dal (United) chief Nitish Kumar and Chandrababu Naidu-led TDP."

West Bengal contributes 42 Lok Sabha seats in the 543-member Parliament. The Bharatiya Janata Party's main focus was to dislodge Mamata Banerjee from West Bengal and even targeted the TMC government over Sandeshkhali.

summary:
In the wake of the 2024 Lok Sabha election results, Maharashtra's Deputy Chief Minister and BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis has expressed his desire to resign from his position, taking full responsibility for the party's poor performance in the state. The BJP won only 9 out of 48 seats in Maharashtra, while its allies Shiv Sena (Eknath Shinde faction) and NCP (Ajit Pawar faction) secured 7 and 1 seat respectively. The NDA coalition managed to win only 17 seats, whereas the INDIA bloc won 30 seats.

Fadnavis thanked the public for re-electing Narendra Modi as Prime Minister but acknowledged the disappointing results in Maharashtra. He mentioned that despite the losses, the vote share was nearly the same as the opposition's. He also noted that a party meeting was held to discuss the results, with plans for further discussions involving Chief Minister Eknath Shinde and Deputy CM Ajit Pawar.

However, Maharashtra BJP President Chandrashekhar Bawankule stated that the party does not intend to relieve Fadnavis of his duties. He suggested that Fadnavis could balance his time between the government and party work. Former Maharashtra Chief Minister Ashok Chavan also mentioned that no decision was made in the core committee meeting regarding Fadnavis's resignation.

summary:
The Lok Sabha Election Results 2024 were declared on June 4, with the BJP winning 240 out of 543 seats, while the Congress secured 99 seats. The NDA coalition, which includes the BJP, won a total of 292 seats, achieving a majority for the third consecutive time, although the BJP alone did not surpass the majority mark of 272 seats. Actor Sunil Lahri, known for his role as Lakshman in the TV show "Ramayan," expressed disappointment over the election results, particularly the BJP's loss in Ayodhya. Bollywood actor Anupam Kher also shared a cryptic post, reflecting on the challenges faced by honest individuals, suggesting that being too honest can lead to suffering, yet it also makes one a source of inspiration for millions. He captioned his post with the word "Truth."

summary: In the wake of the 2024 Lok Sabha election results, political activities in Delhi have intensified as preparations for forming the new government are underway. The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) fell short of the majority mark of 272 seats, securing only 240 seats, which is 32 seats less than needed. However, the National Democratic Alliance (NDA), led by Narendra Modi, is set to form the government for the third time with a total of 291 seats. The Telugu Desam Party (TDP) and Janata Dal (United) (JD-U) are crucial allies, winning 16 and 12 seats respectively. The Congress party and the INDIA alliance saw significant gains, with Congress doubling its seats to 99 and the Samajwadi Party (SP) achieving its best performance with 37 seats under Akhilesh Yadav's leadership. Political maneuvers and statements from various parties are creating suspense as the government formation process continues.

summary:
**Summary:**

The NDA, with a total of 293 seats, will rely on support from allies like the Telugu Desam Party (TDP) and Janata Dal (United) (JDU), who are expected to submit their support letters to the BJP in Delhi. Key leaders, including Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar and TDP President Chandrababu Naidu, will meet to discuss government formation and congratulate Prime Minister Narendra Modi on his anticipated third term. Meanwhile, the opposition alliance INDIA, buoyed by strong performances from the Samajwadi Party in Uttar Pradesh and the Trinamool Congress in West Bengal, has secured 232 seats, with Congress increasing its tally to 99 seats. Both alliances are holding crucial meetings to strategize their next steps.

summary:
In the 2024 Lok Sabha elections, the BJP fell short of a majority, securing 292 seats, while the INDIA alliance won 234 seats. Key figures from the INDIA alliance played crucial roles in preventing Prime Minister Modi from achieving a majority. 

Akhilesh Yadav's strategic moves in Uttar Pradesh significantly hindered the BJP, limiting them to 33 out of 80 seats. Rahul Gandhi's initiatives, including the Bharat Jodo Yatra and Nyay Yatra, helped the Congress secure 99 seats, an improvement from previous elections. Other influential leaders such as Sharad Pawar, Mamata Banerjee, Lalu Prasad Yadav, Priyanka Gandhi, Mallikarjun Kharge, Jairam Ramesh, Uddhav Thackeray, Sitaram Yechury, and Pawan Khera also contributed to the INDIA alliance's success in curbing Modi's momentum.

title: BJP ‡§ï‡•ã ‡§®‡§π‡•Ä‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§≤‡§æ ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§£ ‡§¨‡§π‡•Å‡§Æ‡§§, ‡§Ö‡§¨ PM ‡§Æ‡•ã‡§¶‡•Ä ‡§ï‡•á ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§®‡•á 5 ‡§∏‡§æ‡§≤ ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§ï‡•å‡§® ‡§∏‡•á 5 ‡§¨‡§°‡§º‡•á ‡§ö‡•à‡§≤‡•á‡§Ç‡§ú?
summary:
**Summary:**

In the recent Lok Sabha elections, the BJP did not secure an absolute majority, winning only 240 seats out of 543, while the NDA coalition secured 292 seats. The INDIA alliance won 232 seats. This outcome presents several challenges for Prime Minister Narendra Modi over the next five years:

1. **Maintaining Coalition Unity:** Without a majority, Modi must prioritize keeping the coalition united, considering the interests of allies like Nitish Kumar and Chandrababu Naidu.
2. **Managing Ally Expectations:** Allies will demand more, especially on issues like special state status for Bihar and Andhra Pradesh.
3. **Ideological Differences:** The BJP's differing ideologies with its allies may slow down decisions on contentious issues like the Common Civil Code.
4. **Policy Implementation:** Modi's government needs to effectively implement policies to regain its previous momentum.
5. **Upcoming State Elections:** The BJP faces pressure to perform well in upcoming state elections in Maharashtra, Delhi, and Haryana.

These challenges highlight the complexities Modi will face in governing with a coalition and the need for strategic adjustments.

The BJP emerged as the largest party with 240 seats, whereas Congress fell just short of 100, securing 99 seats. This outcome indicates that Narendra Modi is set to form the government once again. Key figures like Nitish Kumar and Chandrababu Naidu are expected to play significant roles in the new government. Important meetings of both the NDA and INDIA alliances are scheduled to outline the formation of the next government.

title: 2004 ‡§î‡§∞ 2009 ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§≠‡•Ä ‡§π‡•Å‡§Ü ‡§•‡§æ ‡§´‡•á‡§≤, Exit Poll ‡§ï‡•Ä ‡§á‡§∏ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§´‡§ø‡§∞ ‡§ñ‡•Å‡§≤ ‡§ó‡§à ‡§™‡•ã‡§≤
summary:
In the recent 2024 Indian general elections, exit polls have once again proven inaccurate. Despite predictions of a strong wave in favor of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP, the party failed to secure a majority on its own and will need coalition partners to form a government. This discrepancy highlights the unreliable nature of exit polls, which had previously failed in 2004 and 2009 but were accurate in 2014 and 2019.

Key exit polls, including those by Axis My India, C Voter, and Today Chanakya, had forecasted the NDA winning between 350 to 400 seats, but the actual results fell short by about 100 seats. The I.N.D.I.A. coalition performed better than expected in states like West Bengal, Haryana, Punjab, and Rajasthan, contrary to exit poll predictions. The BJP's performance in Uttar Pradesh was also weaker than anticipated.

This outcome underscores the limitations of exit polls and the challenges in accurately predicting election results.

summary:
The results of the 2024 Lok Sabha elections have been announced, with the NDA securing a full majority. Following the announcement, several foreign leaders have congratulated Prime Minister Narendra Modi and expressed a desire to strengthen relations with India. Key congratulatory messages include:

1. **Mauritius Prime Minister Pravind Kumar Jugnauth**: He congratulated PM Modi on his historic third term and expressed hope for continued progress and strong Mauritius-India relations. PM Modi thanked him and emphasized the importance of their partnership.

2. **Shering Tobgay**: He congratulated PM Modi and the NDA on their historic win and expressed eagerness to work together to strengthen India-Bhutan relations. PM Modi responded with gratitude and optimism for ongoing strong ties.

The election results show the NDA winning 292 out of 542 seats, while the I.N.D.I.A alliance secured 233 seats. Although the BJP did not achieve the majority on its own, the NDA's overall majority allows them to form the government. This marks a significant political outcome, with the BJP previously winning 278 seats in 2014 and 303 seats in 2019.

title: ‡§¶‡§≤‡§¨‡§¶‡§≤‡•Ç ‡§®‡•á‡§§‡§æ‡§ì‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•á BJP ‡§ï‡•ã ‡§π‡•Å‡§Ü ‡§®‡•Å‡§ï‡§∏‡§æ‡§®! ‡§ú‡§æ‡§®‡•á‡§Ç ‡§Ø‡•Ç‡§™‡•Ä ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§π‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡•á ‡§¨‡§°‡§º‡•á ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡§£
summary:
**Summary:**

In the 2024 Lok Sabha elections, the BJP faced a significant setback in Uttar Pradesh despite efforts to replicate their 2014 and 2019 successes. The party had incorporated several leaders from other parties, including more than half a dozen Samajwadi Party (SP) MLAs, to strengthen their position. Notable SP defectors included Rakesh Pandey, Rakesh Pratap Singh, Abhay Singh, Manoj Pandey, Vinod Chaturvedi, Pooja Pal, and Ashutosh Maurya, who had previously cross-voted for the BJP in the Rajya Sabha elections. Additionally, BJP fielded former Congress member RPN Singh for the Rajya Sabha and Jitin Prasada for the Lok Sabha, and also brought back former MLC Yashwant and supported strongman Dhananjay Singh. However, these strategies did not yield the expected results, leading to BJP's poor performance in the state.

summary:
In the 2024 Lok Sabha elections, the Congress party has made significant gains, with Rahul Gandhi winning both the Wayanad and Rae Bareli seats. Rahul expressed gratitude to the voters of both constituencies via a Twitter video, stating his preference to serve as MP for both if possible. He won Rae Bareli by over 400,000 votes and Wayanad by 364,422 votes, defeating CPI leader Annie Raja in Wayanad.

The Wayanad constituency has a diverse voter base, including 3% Scheduled Castes, 9.5% Scheduled Tribes, 32% Muslims, and 13% Christians.

The election results show the NDA alliance securing 291 seats, while the INDIA bloc won 234 seats. The BJP remains the largest party for the third consecutive term with 240 seats, although it did not achieve an outright majority this time. The opposition's INDIA alliance, comprising 20 parties, has significantly strengthened its position.

summary:
The 2024 Lok Sabha election results in India have surprised many. The NDA coalition, led by the BJP, failed to achieve its goal of winning over 400 seats, securing around 295+ seats instead. The opposition INDIA alliance made significant gains, winning 231+ seats. The BJP alone did not reach the majority mark, winning 240 seats, while the Congress secured 100 seats.

Key figures include Rahul Gandhi, who won decisively in Wayanad and Raebareli, and Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who secured his third consecutive win in Varanasi. The BJP faced setbacks in Uttar Pradesh, winning only 35 seats, with the Samajwadi Party, led by Akhilesh Yadav, making significant inroads.

In Bihar, Chief Minister Nitish Kumar of the JD(U) and N. Chandrababu Naidu of the TDP emerged as potential kingmakers. The TDP won 16 seats, and the JD(U) matched the BJP's 12 seats in Bihar. Reports suggest that INDIA alliance leaders are reaching out to these key figures to form a majority, though this has not been confirmed by the Congress.

Important meetings are scheduled for June 5 in Delhi, including those of the INDIA alliance and the NDA. The central cabinet is also expected to meet, and preparations for the new government's swearing-in ceremony, likely on June 9, will begin.

However, the BJP did not secure a majority on its own, winning 291 seats, thus relying on coalition partners. The opposition alliance, INDIA, won 234 seats. 3. The election results reflect a mandate for continuity and stability, despite the BJP's reduced majority.
4. The opposition's failure to capitalize on opportunities due to internal contradictions and lack of a strong narrative.

The article emphasizes the importance of flexibility and coalition management for the Modi government and highlights lessons for the opposition in terms of strategy and unity.

summary:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed party workers following the results of the 2024 Lok Sabha elections, where the NDA appears to have secured a majority. Modi expressed gratitude for the public mandate and emotionally remembered his late mother, stating that the women of India filled the void left by her passing. He highlighted the significant voter turnout among women and their support.

Modi declared the victory as a triumph for democracy, the Indian Constitution, and the vision of a developed India. He praised the dedication of party workers and mentioned former Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu and Nitish Kumar.

The NDA also achieved substantial victories in various state assembly elections, including Andhra Pradesh, Odisha, Sikkim, and Arunachal Pradesh, where the Congress party faced significant losses. Modi noted the BJP's historic win in Odisha and a seat in Kerala, acknowledging the sacrifices and efforts of party workers in these regions. The BJP also saw increased support in Telangana.

title: BJP ‡§®‡•á ‡§ú‡•Ä‡§§‡•Ä ‡§ö‡§æ‡§Ç‡§¶‡§®‡•Ä ‡§ö‡•å‡§ï ‡§∏‡•Ä‡§ü, ‡§™‡§ø‡§õ‡§≤‡•Ä ‡§¨‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡•á ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§¨‡§≤‡•á ‡§Ü‡§ß‡•á ‡§∏‡•á ‡§≠‡•Ä ‡§ï‡§Æ ‡§∞‡§π ‡§ó‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ú‡•Ä‡§§ ‡§ï‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§Ç‡§§‡§∞
summary:
In the 2024 Lok Sabha elections, BJP candidate Praveen Khandelwal won the Chandni Chowk seat in Delhi, defeating Congress's JP Agarwal in a close contest. This marks BJP's third consecutive victory in this constituency and a hat-trick of wins across all seven Delhi seats. Khandelwal, a first-time MP candidate, secured 516,496 votes against Agarwal's 427,171, winning by a margin of 89,325 votes. Notably, the victory margin was significantly reduced compared to the previous election, where BJP won by over 200,000 votes.

JP Agarwal, aged 79, was the oldest candidate in Delhi and had previously won the Chandni Chowk seat three times (1984, 1989, 1996) but lost in 2019. In the 2019 elections, BJP's Harsh Vardhan won the seat in a triangular contest against Agarwal and AAP's Pankaj Kumar Gupta with a 2.28 lakh vote margin. This time, Congress and AAP contested under the INDIA alliance.

Post-victory, Khandelwal expressed his commitment to working for the people, focusing on simplifying GST, training traders in technology, developing JJ colonies, and improving market infrastructure. Chandni Chowk constituency has over 1.6 million voters and includes ten assembly segments: Model Town, Tri Nagar, Shakur Basti, Shalimar Bagh, Adarsh Nagar, Chandni Chowk, Sadar Bazar, Ballimaran, Wazirpur, and Matia Mahal.

As the vote counting for the 2024 Lok Sabha elections nears its final stages, the NDA is leading in over 290 seats, while the INDIA alliance is ahead in more than 220 seats. Shinde attributed the losses to the opposition's misinformation about constitutional changes and the NDA's delayed candidate announcements. He also mentioned that vote bank politics negatively impacted the NDA's performance. Specific instances include the Nasik Lok Sabha seat and changes in candidates for Hingoli and Yavatmal-Washim constituencies, where the party's candidates are trailing.

summary:
**Summary:**

In the context of the 2024 Lok Sabha election results, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi appeared optimistic, holding a copy of the Constitution and emphasizing the mandate to protect it. At that time, the INDIA alliance was leading in 235 seats, while the BJP-led NDA was ahead in 290 seats, surpassing the majority mark of 272. However, the BJP's reduced tally of 240 seats, compared to 303 in 2019, sparked hope in the Congress camp that Rahul Gandhi could potentially form the next government.

When asked whether he would prefer to work from the opposition or attempt to form a government, Rahul deferred to Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge, who suggested consulting allies before making a decision. Rahul's response highlighted the complexities of coalition politics.

To form a government, the INDIA alliance would need to secure additional support, potentially from NDA partners like the Telugu Desam Party (TDP) with 16 MPs and Janata Dal United (JDU) with 12 MPs, as well as independents. This could bring their total to 270, just shy of the majority. Further support might come from AIMIM and other smaller parties, potentially reaching 274 seats. However, this remains challenging due to the political stances of key figures like Nitish Kumar and Chandrababu Naidu.

summary:

In the 2024 Lok Sabha elections, the opposition's INDIA Alliance has performed better than expected, while the ruling NDA, led by the BJP, has underperformed compared to its pre-election claims. Key leaders from the INDIA Alliance, including Rahul Gandhi, Sharad Pawar, Uddhav Thackeray, Mamata Banerjee, and Akhilesh Yadav, have seen their influence grow due to the election results.

- **NDA Performance:** The NDA, which claimed it would win over 400 seats, is struggling to reach 300 seats. The BJP is leading in 241 seats, a significant drop from the 303 seats it won in 2019.
- **INDIA Alliance Performance:** Contrary to predictions that it would not win 200 seats, the INDIA Alliance is leading in 231 seats. The Congress, part of this alliance, is leading in 99 seats, a substantial increase from its 52 seats in 2019.
- **Key Leaders:**
  - **Rahul Gandhi:** His efforts to revive the Congress are paying off, with the party nearing 100 seats. He is leading in both Wayanad (Kerala) and Rae Bareli (Uttar Pradesh).
  - **Mamata Banerjee:** The TMC is leading in 29 out of 42 seats in West Bengal, an improvement from 22 seats in 2019, while the BJP's seats have decreased.
  - **Sharad Pawar and Uddhav Thackeray:** In Maharashtra, the INDIA Alliance is performing well, with the Shiv Sena (UBT) and NCP (Sharad Pawar) showing strong results despite internal splits.
  - **Akhilesh Yadav:** The Samajwadi Party is leading in 35 out of 80 seats in Uttar Pradesh, a significant gain from its 5 seats in 2019, while the BJP is facing a major loss in the state.

These results indicate a shift in the political landscape, with the INDIA Alliance gaining ground and key opposition leaders strengthening their positions.

summary:
In the 2024 Uttar Pradesh Lok Sabha elections, the Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) failed to maintain its 2014 record, with the party heading towards zero seats in Parliament. The BSP's vote share dropped to 9.36%, a significant decline from 19.77% in 2014. In contrast, the INDIA alliance, comprising the Samajwadi Party (SP) and Congress, performed well, while the BJP's performance deteriorated, securing 41.40% of the votes compared to 49.98% in 2019.

Political analysts attribute BSP's poor performance to several mistakes by its leader, Mayawati. These include a lack of strong stance on constitutional and reservation issues, poor candidate selection, and internal party issues such as the removal of Akash Anand from responsibilities mid-election, which confused the youth. The BSP's vote base seemingly shifted towards the INDIA alliance, which was more vocal on key issues.

title: Amethi Seat Result: ‡§∞‡§æ‡§π‡•Å‡§≤ ‡§®‡•á ‡§õ‡•ã‡§°‡§º‡•Ä, ‡§™‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∏ ‡§ï‡•á ‡§ï‡§ø‡§∂‡•ã‡§∞‡•Ä ‡§®‡•á ‡§ú‡•Ä‡§§ ‡§≤‡•Ä ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•á‡§†‡•Ä, ‡§ú‡§æ‡§®‡•á‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡•É‡§§‡§ø ‡§ï‡•ã ‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§®‡•á ‡§µ‡§æ‡§≤‡•á ‡§Ø‡•á ‡§®‡•á‡§§‡§æ ‡§π‡•à‡§Ç ‡§ï‡•å‡§®?
summary:
In the 2024 Lok Sabha elections, the BJP-led NDA secured 295 seats, ensuring a third term for Narendra Modi as Prime Minister, though he will need support from allies like Nitish Kumar and Chandrababu Naidu. The BJP faced significant losses, particularly in Uttar Pradesh, winning only 35 out of 80 seats, while the INDIA alliance led in 37 seats.

A major upset occurred in Amethi, where Congress candidate Kishori Lal Sharma defeated BJP's Smriti Irani by a margin of 1.30 lakh votes. Sharma, a trusted aide of the Gandhi family and a political strategist, dedicated his victory to the Congress party. He has a long history with the Gandhi family, starting his political career in 1983 with Rajiv Gandhi and later becoming a close associate of Sonia Gandhi.

Smriti Irani's defeat is attributed to her overconfidence, failure to connect with voters, and underestimating Sharma. In contrast, Sharma maintained strong grassroots connections and worked diligently in Amethi, which contributed to his victory. This win also avenged Rahul Gandhi's previous loss to Irani in 2019.

One notable case is Maulana Badruddin Ajmal of the All India United Democratic Front (AIUDF) from the Dhubri Lok Sabha seat in Assam, which has a 55% Muslim voter base. The results of the 2024 Lok Sabha elections have started coming in, with several Bhojpuri superstars contesting. Dinesh Lal Yadav 'Nirahua' is contesting against SP's Dharmendra Yadav in Azamgarh. In 2019, SP's Akhilesh Yadav won the seat but later vacated it, leading to Nirahua's by-election win in 2022.

In the 2024 Lok Sabha election results, no single party has achieved a clear majority. The ruling National Democratic Alliance (NDA) is projected to win 296 seats, while the INDIA alliance is expected to secure 230 seats. In Uttar Pradesh, the partnership between Rahul Gandhi and Akhilesh Yadav has been successful. This raises the question of whether the INDIA alliance can form the central government. On social media, similar questions are being discussed. With 230 seats, the INDIA alliance falls 72 seats short of the majority mark.

Despite being far from the majority, the INDIA alliance is likely to gain support from the Trinamool Congress if it attempts to form a government. Nitish Kumar, who initiated the INDIA alliance and hosted its first meeting in Patna, is a key figure in this context. The BJP had formed a government with the Janata Dal (United) in January 2024.

title: ‡§ö‡•Å‡§®‡§æ‡§µ‡•Ä ‡§®‡§§‡•Ä‡§ú‡•ã‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•á ‡§¨‡•Ä‡§ú‡•á‡§™‡•Ä ‡§ï‡•ã ‡§ù‡§ü‡§ï‡§æ...‡§á‡§® 5 ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡§£‡•ã‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•á INDIA ‡§ó‡§†‡§¨‡§Ç‡§ß‡§® NDA ‡§™‡§∞ ‡§≠‡§æ‡§∞‡•Ä
summary:
In the 2024 Lok Sabha election results, the NDA alliance has secured a majority, but the opposition INDIA alliance has given a tough competition. The BJP failed to achieve a clear majority, unlike in 2019. The opposition successfully capitalized on the anti-incumbency sentiment against the Modi government. Here are the five main reasons for BJP's setback:

1. **Effective Opposition Campaign**: The opposition's narrative on issues like reservation and constitutional changes resonated with voters, while BJP's campaign failed to connect.
2. **Impact of Regional Parties**: Regional parties like Akhilesh Yadav's SP in Uttar Pradesh, TMC in West Bengal, and DMK in Tamil Nadu performed well, significantly affecting BJP's results, especially in Uttar Pradesh.
3. **Muslim Voter Support**: The Muslim community largely voted for the INDIA alliance, as indicated by exit polls.
4. **Youth Voter Preference**: Young voters (ages 18-35) preferred the INDIA alliance, seeking change, while BJP's voter base was older.
5. **Trust in Congress Manifesto**: Congress's promises, such as the 'Nyay' scheme and job guarantees for youth, gained public trust and proved effective.

These factors collectively contributed to the BJP's inability to secure a clear majority in the 2024 elections.

This is surprising for the BJP, which had high expectations from Uttar Pradesh (UP), hoping to win 72-75 out of 80 seats. However, current trends show the BJP trailing behind the INDIA alliance in UP, with the BJP leading in 37 seats and the INDIA alliance in 42.

The BJP had previously dominated UP in the 2014 and 2019 elections, winning 71 and 62 seats respectively. Despite the inauguration of the Ram Temple and the perceived strong support for Hindutva, the BJP's strategy failed against the opposition's social coalition and strategic planning. The INDIA alliance, particularly the partnership between the Samajwadi Party (SP) and Congress, has proven effective, focusing on positive issues and gaining public trust.

The BJP fielded candidates in 75 out of 80 seats in UP, with allies contesting the remaining seats. The INDIA alliance, comprising SP and Congress, contested together, with Congress fielding candidates in 17 seats and SP in the rest. The BJP's overconfidence and failure to gauge ground realities have led to its unexpected setback in its stronghold of UP.

summary:
In the Wayanad Lok Sabha election results, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is leading significantly. He is competing against BJP's state president K. Surendran and CPI's senior leader Annie Raja. Despite Congress and CPI being part of the INDIA alliance nationally, they are contesting against each other in Kerala. Rahul Gandhi is also contesting from Uttar Pradesh's Raebareli seat.

As per the current vote count, Rahul Gandhi has received over 550,000 votes, Annie Raja has over 246,000 votes, and K. Surendran has more than 128,000 votes. In the 2019 elections, Rahul Gandhi won the Wayanad seat with over 700,000 votes, while CPI's P.P. Suneer was second with around 275,000 votes.

The Wayanad seat was created after the 2008 delimitation, and Congress has consistently won since then. The constituency includes seven assembly seats spread across Wayanad, Malappuram, and Kozhikode districts. The population is predominantly Muslim (46%), with significant Christian (11%), tribal (9%), and SC (6%) communities.

Key issues in Wayanad include the implementation of the CAA, healthcare deficiencies, delays in railway line construction between Nilambur and Nanjangud, and highway construction between Mananthavady and Bavali. Despite the national alliance, CPI's Annie Raja is contesting against Congress in Kerala, highlighting internal conflicts within the INDIA alliance. Political analysts note that Congress General Secretary K.C. Venugopal, a native of Kannur, played a key role in bringing Rahul Gandhi to Wayanad.

- Congress candidates are leading in Saharanpur, Amroha, Sitapur, Rae Bareli, Amethi, Allahabad, and Barabanki.

These results indicate a significant shift in voter sentiment in UP, impacting BJP's overall performance.

summary: In the 2024 Lok Sabha elections, several celebrities are leading in their respective constituencies. Actress Kangana Ranaut, contesting from Mandi, Himachal Pradesh on a BJP ticket, is ahead of Congress candidate Vikramaditya Singh by 57,000 votes. Actor Arun Govil, known for his role as Ram in the TV series "Ramayan," is leading in Meerut, Uttar Pradesh by 2,753 votes. Hema Malini is set to win her third term from Mathura, leading by 1.7 lakh votes against Congress's Mukesh Dhangar. In Kerala's Thrissur, BJP candidate and actor Suresh Gopi is ahead by over 63,000 votes. TMC candidate Shatrughan Sinha is leading in Asansol, West Bengal by 37,000 votes. BJP candidates Manoj Tiwari and Ravi Kishan are leading in North East Delhi and Gorakhpur, respectively, while BJP's Locket Chatterjee is trailing in Hooghly, West Bengal.

title: ‡§Ö‡§≠‡•Ä ‡§§‡•ã ‡§á‡§∞‡§æ‡§¶‡•ã‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§æ ‡§á‡§Æ‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§® ‡§¨‡§æ‡§ï‡•Ä ‡§π‡•à... NDA ‡§ï‡•Ä ‡§ú‡•Ä‡§§ ‡§ï‡•á ‡§¨‡§æ‡§µ‡§ú‡•Ç‡§¶ ‡§¨‡•Ä‡§ú‡•á‡§™‡•Ä ‡§ï‡•á ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡§®‡•á ‡§ö‡•Å‡§®‡•å‡§§‡§ø‡§Ø‡•ã‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§æ ‡§™‡§π‡§æ‡§°‡§º
summary:
**Summary:**

The 2024 Lok Sabha election results indicate significant challenges for the BJP despite the NDA's potential to form the government. The opposition's INDIA alliance is giving a tough fight, particularly in key states like Uttar Pradesh and Bihar, leading to substantial losses for the BJP, which is falling short of a majority on its own. The BJP is projected to win around 250 seats, a loss of approximately 60 seats from the previous election. Key allies like Nitish Kumar's JDU and the TDP are crucial, with Kumar potentially becoming a kingmaker. The BJP's bargaining power is reduced compared to 2014 and 2019, and it may need to compromise on major ministerial positions. Additionally, the BJP's agenda items like the Uniform Civil Code and population control laws may face hurdles due to the need for coalition support.

title: ‡§≤‡§ñ‡§®‡§ä ‡§Æ‡§§‡§ó‡§£‡§®‡§æ ‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§≤ ‡§™‡§∞ ‡§≠‡§ø‡§°‡§º‡•á ‡§∏‡§™‡§æ-‡§≠‡§æ‡§ú‡§™‡§æ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§æ, ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§µ‡§ï ‡§ï‡§æ ‡§´‡•Ç‡§ü‡§æ ‡§∏‡§ø‡§∞
summary:
In Lucknow, during the ongoing vote counting for the 2024 Lok Sabha elections at the Ramabai Ambedkar ground, a clash erupted between supporters of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and the Samajwadi Party (SP). The altercation led to a SP worker sustaining a head injury. The conflict reportedly began with a verbal dispute that escalated into physical violence.

The vote counting in Uttar Pradesh, which has 80 Lok Sabha seats, started at 8 AM across 81 centers in 75 districts. Initial counting began with postal ballots, followed by Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs). Exit polls have suggested a favorable outcome for the ruling BJP, prompting opposition parties like SP and Congress to prepare rigorously for the counting process. SP leader Akhilesh Yadav accused the government of deliberately slowing down the counting process due to BJP's declining seat count. As of now, the "INDIA" alliance is leading in 43 seats, while the NDA is ahead in 36 seats.

title: ECI, results.eci.gov.in Lok Sabha Chunav Parinam 2024 LIVE: ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§Ø ‡§ú‡§®‡§§‡§æ ‡§¶‡§≤ ‡§ï‡•Ä ‡§¨‡§ø‡§π‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§ß‡§Æ‡§ï, ‡§¨‡•Ä‡§ú‡•á‡§™‡•Ä ‡§ï‡•ã ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§™‡•Ä‡§õ‡•á, ‡§¶‡•á‡§ñ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§Ü‡§Ç‡§ï‡§°‡§º‡•á
summary: The Election Commission of India (ECI) is conducting the counting of votes for the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. The National Democratic Alliance (NDA) is on track to secure a majority, with the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leading in several key areas. In Uttar Pradesh, there is a close contest between BJP (33 seats) and Samajwadi Party (36 seats). Current tallies show BJP with 238 seats, Indian National Congress (INC) with 97, and Samajwadi Party with 34. High-profile candidates include Narendra Modi leading in Varanasi, Rahul Gandhi leading in Wayanad and Rae Bareli, and other notable figures like Ashok Gehlot's son and Lalu Yadav's daughter contesting in Rajasthan and Bihar, respectively. The final results are expected by the evening of June 4, 2024. Exit polls predict a significant victory for the NDA, with estimates ranging from 370 to 401 seats. The counting process includes postal ballots first, followed by EVM votes, and VVPAT verification, which may delay the final results. The ECI will update results on their website and mobile apps.

title: ‡§®‡§π‡•Ä‡§Ç ‡§ö‡§≤‡§æ ‡§Æ‡•ã‡§¶‡•Ä ‡§Æ‡•à‡§ú‡§ø‡§ï, ‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∏ ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§§ ‡§≠‡§æ‡§∞‡§§ ‡§ï‡§æ ‡§Æ‡•ã‡§¶‡•Ä ‡§ï‡§æ ‡§∏‡§™‡§®‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§ß‡•Ç‡§∞‡§æ ‡§∞‡§π ‡§ó‡§Ø‡§æ
summary:
In a recent analysis, it was highlighted that Prime Minister Narendra Modi's vision of a "Congress-free India" remains unfulfilled. Despite Modi's significant victories in the 2014 and 2019 elections, where the BJP secured 282 and 303 seats respectively, the Congress party has shown resilience. In 2014, Congress was reduced to 44 seats, losing its status as the main opposition party. However, by 2019, it had increased its tally to 52 seats.

As the 2024 general elections approach, exit polls suggest that Congress might surpass 100 seats, indicating a resurgence. Modi's campaign has continued to target Congress with accusations of dynastic politics and minority appeasement, but these attacks have not significantly diminished Congress's appeal to voters.

Recent exit polls predicted a strong performance for the BJP-led NDA, estimating 365 seats, but actual results indicate that the BJP may not achieve a majority on its own, falling short of the 272-seat mark. This development underscores the challenges Modi faces in realizing his goal of a Congress-free India.
